titleStmt.title: The schollers purgatory discouered in the Stationers common-wealth, and discribed in a discourse apologeticall, asvvell for the publike aduantage of the Church, the state & vvhole common-vvealth of England, as for the remedy of priuate iniuryes. By Geo: VVither.
titleStmt.author: Wither, George, 1588-1667.

titleStmt.title: The schollers purgatory discouered in the Stationers common-wealth, and discribed in a discourse apologeticall, asvvell for the publike aduantage of the Church, the state & vvhole common-vvealth of England, as for the remedy of priuate iniuryes. By Geo: VVither.
titleStmt.author: Wither, George, 1588-1667.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprinted [by G. Wood] for the honest Stationers,

notesStmt.note: A defense of Wither's patent for his: The hymnes and songs of the Church.
Printer's name and publication date from STC.
Quires A-D are apparently from one type font and E-I from another, with quire (.)̇⁴ possibly printed at the second press (STC).
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
